transcripts.text: I'm Juliana Forlano here at Netroots Nation 2019 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  I'm here with show host, beloved show host I might add, at least for me for sure, Tom Hartman.  Tom, thanks for joining me today.
Thanks, Juliana.  It's an honor to be here with you.  I really appreciate the great work you're doing out there on BAI and everywhere else.

Thank you so much, and I feel very much the same way.  In fact, your show is what got me excited to do progressive media, and I think it's so necessary in this day and age.  Can you talk about where we're at in terms of progressive media given the fact that so much media is corporate?

Well, you know, what happened in the mid-'80s was that a bunch of very wealthy people who owned a bunch of media kind of came to the conclusion, hey, if we build out a media structure, a corporate conservative media structure, we can change the course of political history.  We can influence America.  And they did.  And the Limbaugh Show started in 87, as I recall.  And it was on 50 some odd stations.  And I think probably most of them were Clear Channel stations.  Clear Channel, over time, turned into a right wing network.  Romney took it over.  You've got now Sinclair.  I mean, there's just place after place after place where we're seeing these happening.

How have the progressives not noticed that this is happening and then started their own?  I mean, we're here.  There's a media row of progressive people talking, but it's not a Fox News.  It's not a Sinclair.  We haven't grabbed local markets.  Why haven't progressives done this?
